hints.content:
We can think of division as the following:

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\blueD{\text{ Number of Groups}}$

or 

$\greenD{\text{ Total}}\div\maroonD{\text{ Size of the Groups}}$

We have a $\greenD{\text{total}}$ of $\greenD6$ eggs.

The $\blueD{\text{number of groups}}$ of eggs is $\blueD3$.  

Which image shows $\greenD{6}$ eggs divided  evenly in $\blueD{3}$ groups?

This image represents the situation:

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Three groups of 2 eggs. Each group of eggs has a circle around it. !

question.content:
There are $6$ eggs divided evenly in $3$ baskets.

**Which image could represent this situation?**


[[☃ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![Two groups of 6 eggs. Each group of eggs has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/aba3133187fd3834bbe30ead61ba31fd5dee47c9)
![Three groups of 2 eggs. Each group of eggs has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a92331bdf10c5fda0ec2f7055f3a9b9a01bc4ee2)
![Three groups of 3 eggs. Each group of eggs has a circle around it.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/441b04efea9fd46743b581fbfef5faa0bc0970ba)
